(2) Make Driver/Mechanism and What to Watch one crisp clause each per line; avoid multi‑clause composites, and cite every factual claim with the appropriate IDs. (3) For the Swing Trade, since ETH is tradable, replace the current diffuse lines with a single or pair of concise lines: Direction Up | Horizon 3–6 months | Entry at around the prevailing ETH price band (cite the ~4,000–5,000 anchor from OGK8WLL69) | Stop at a defined support level | Target near prior highs/ATH (documented in OGK8WLL69) | R/R and Invalidation tied to ETF inflows/staking momentum (cite NL5YYTLF2/OGK8WLL69) | Trigger (e.g., sustained ETF inflows >$5B/month) | Probability % anchored to the cited evidence (e.g., 65%) | Confidence 60–65. (5) Clean up conflicts and reconciliation: apply a single default regime bias (Regime A on disinflation with easing) unless wage/inflation momentum solidifies Regime B/C, with a defined ±5% probability swing rule and explicit cross‑source reconciliation (NL5YYTLF2/R3WNA7L7A). (6) Ensure every assertion using numbers or facts has an in‑text ID from the SOURCE MATERIAL and remove trailing reference lists; deliver four polished Movers lines plus one concise Swing/Outlook line per the constraints.
